verses.kjv: Rejoice not, O Israel, for joy, as other people: for thou hast gone a whoring from thy God, thou hast loved a reward upon every cornfloor.
verses.ct: Don't celebrate, Israel! Don't rejoice like other nations do, because you have been unfaithful to your God. You have loved the prostitute's wages on every threshing floor.

verses.kjv: The floor and the winepress shall not feed them, and the new wine shall fail in her.
verses.ct: The threshing floor and winepress won't sustain them, and the new wine will run out.

verses.kjv: They shall not dwell in the LORD’s land; but Ephraim shall return to Egypt, and they shall eat unclean things in Assyria.
verses.ct: They won't remain in the LORD's land. Instead, Ephraim will go back to Egypt, and they will eat ritually unclean food in Assyria.

verses.kjv: They shall not offer wine offerings to the LORD, neither shall they be pleasing unto him: their sacrifices shall be unto them as the bread of mourners; all that eat thereof shall be polluted: for their bread for their soul shall not come into the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: They won't pour out wine offerings to the LORD, and their sacrifices won't please him. Their sacrifices will be like the bread eaten at a funeral — everyone who eats it becomes defiled. Their food will only be for their own hunger; it won't enter the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: What will ye do in the solemn day, and in the day of the feast of the LORD?
verses.ct: What will you do on the day of the appointed festival, on the day of the LORD's feast?

verses.kjv: For, lo, they are gone because of destruction: Egypt shall gather them up, Memphis shall bury them: the pleasant places for their silver, nettles shall possess them: thorns shall be in their tabernacles.
verses.ct: Look — they are fleeing from destruction. Egypt will round them up, and Memphis will bury them. Weeds will take over the treasured places where their silver was kept, and thorns will grow in their tents.

verses.kjv: The days of visitation are come, the days of recompence are come; Israel shall know it: the prophet is a fool, the spiritual man is mad, for the multitude of thine iniquity, and the great hatred.
verses.ct: The days of punishment have arrived, the days of payback have come. Israel will realize it. They say, 'The prophet is a fool! The man of the spirit has lost his mind!' — but this is because of your enormous sin and deep hostility.

verses.kjv: The watchman of Ephraim was with my God: but the prophet is a snare of a fowler in all his ways, and hatred in the house of his God.
verses.ct: The prophet was supposed to be Ephraim's watchman alongside my God, but instead he has become a hunter's trap on every path, and there is hostility even in the house of his God.

verses.kjv: They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah: therefore he will remember their iniquity, he will visit their sins.
verses.ct: They have sunk deep into corruption, just like in the days of Gibeah. God will remember their guilt and punish their sins.

verses.kjv: I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness; I saw your fathers as the firstripe in the fig tree at her first time: but they went to Baalpeor, and separated themselves unto that shame; and their abominations were according as they loved.
verses.ct: When I first found Israel, it was like discovering grapes in the desert. When I first saw your ancestors, they were like the earliest figs on a fig tree. But then they went to Baal-peor and devoted themselves to that shameful idol, and they became as disgusting as the thing they loved.

verses.kjv: As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird, from the birth, and from the womb, and from the conception.
verses.ct: Ephraim's glory will fly away like a bird — no birth, no pregnancy, no conception.

verses.kjv: Though they bring up their children, yet will I bereave them, that there shall not be a man left: yea, woe also to them when I depart from them!
verses.ct: Even if they do raise children, I will take every one of them away until no one is left. How terrible it will be for them when I turn away from them!

verses.kjv: Ephraim, as I saw Tyrus, is planted in a pleasant place: but Ephraim shall bring forth his children to the murderer.
verses.ct: I once saw Ephraim like Tyre, planted in a beautiful meadow. But now Ephraim will lead their own children out to the slaughter.

verses.kjv: Give them, O LORD: what wilt thou give? give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.
verses.ct: Give them what they deserve, LORD — what should you give them? Give them wombs that miscarry and breasts that produce no milk.

verses.kjv: All their wickedness is in Gilgal: for there I hated them: for the wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of mine house, I will love them no more: all their princes are revolters.
verses.ct: All their evil is concentrated at Gilgal — that is where I began to despise them. Because of their wicked actions, I will drive them out of my house. I will stop loving them. All their leaders are rebels.

verses.kjv: Ephraim is smitten, their root is dried up, they shall bear no fruit: yea, though they bring forth, yet will I slay even the beloved fruit of their womb.
verses.ct: Ephraim is struck down; their roots have dried up, and they will produce no fruit. Even if they do have children, I will kill the precious offspring of their womb.

verses.kjv: My God will cast them away, because they did not hearken unto him: and they shall be wanderers among the nations.
verses.ct: My God will reject them because they refused to listen to him, and they will become wanderers among the nations.
